restrict: ◎第一階段需人工加選◎第二階段需人工加選◎加退選階段需人工加選
description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus: General English (I) Instructor: 蘇席瑤 Hsi-Yao SuE-mail: hsysu@ntnu.edu.twOffice: Cheng (誠) 718Office hours: Thursdays: 10:30 am-12:30 pm, Fridays: 1:30 pm—3:30 pm Course Description:This course aims to improve students’ English proficiency by providing them with intensive training in four skills. It includes a variety of classroom activities designed to expose them to a wide range of real-life issues, improve their communication skills in English, and enhance their critical and creative thinking. Students will also gain abundant experience in working with their classmates. As a requirement of this course, students will also work on a project, which will enable them to apply their English skills and showcase their creativity. Course Objectives:This course aims to (1) develop students’ four skills in English; (2) improve their knowledge of vocabulary and grammar in English; (3) build their confidence in speaking English; (4) enhance their learning motivation; (5) foster their cultural knowledge and intercultural competence. Delivery of instruction:Lectures, class activities, group discussions, & student presentations. Textbook: Daise, D., & Norloff, C. (2015). Q: Skills for success–Reading and writing (Book 4). New York, NY: Cambridge University Press. Grading Policy & Course Requirements:1. Grading Policy: (1) Attendance/participation: 15% (2) Assignments & Quizzes: 15% (3) Self-learning: 10% (4) Midterm project: 20% (5) Final project: 30% (6) Lexile Test: 10%2. Course requirements(1) Attendance & Participation (15%)Class attendance is a fundamental requirement that will be strictly enforced in this course. Students are required to come to class every week. 3 unexcused absences will result in a failing grade. (2) Assignments & Quizzes (10%)Quizzes will be conducted in class. If students miss any of the quizzes, no make-up quizzes will be given. Students are required to submit any of their assignments (including reports and projects) before it is due. Late assignments will be marked down by a letter grade (e.g. A B). Once they are three or more days late, they will NOT be accepted.(3) Self-learning (10%)Students are required to complete at least 10 hours of self-learning from the following 3 sources:1. 樸101 自學教室2. quizlet.com3. www.iqonlinepractice.com (4) Midterm presentation (20%): Topics will be announced 2-3 weeks before the scheduled mid-term time. (5) Final Project (30%): All final projects include 3 parts: an original script, a performance based on the script, and a short narrative of the character(6) Lexile Test (10%): The Lexile Test is a required English proficiency test for all students enrolled in freshman English classes. In this semester, this test will be arranged in a class meeting from October 7th to November 8th. Students will be informed of when and where they should go to take this test.Note: plagiarism of any form is strictly prohibited and results in a failing grade.
